body_html:
What are you printing from shp to see the (?,?,1)? Against the head version, I tried the following and could not reproduce it. I also tried to run shp in my session, but that requires an actual value of the placeholder in order to run.

import tensorflow as tf
n=1
x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(None, None, n), name='x')
shp = tf.shape(x)
print(str(shp))
print(x.get_shape())

Output:
Tensor("Shape:0", shape=(3,), dtype=int32)
(?, ?, 1)

body:
What are you printing from shp to see the (?,?,1)?  Against the head version, I tried the following and could not reproduce it.  I also tried to run shp in my session, but that requires an actual value of the placeholder in order to run.

import tensorflow as tf
 n=1
 x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(None, None, n), name='x')
 shp = tf.shape(x)
 print(str(shp))
 print(x.get_shape())

Output:
Tensor("Shape:0", shape=(3,), dtype=int32)
(?, ?, 1)
